column2: Northeast states (Alagoas, Bahia, Ceará, Maranhão, Paraíba, Pernambuco, Piauí, Rio Grande do Norte and Sergipe)
column6:
Microcephaly: suspected cases reported in the RESP database only
ZIKV: suspected and confirmed cases reported through sentinel surveillance system

column2: Northeast states (Alagoas, Bahia, Ceará, Maranhão, Paraíba, Pernambuco, Piauí, Rio Grande do Norte and Sergipe)
column6:
Microcephaly: infection related, confirmation based on diagnostic approach, either neuroimaging or laboratory test. See methods and appendix of source.
ZIKV: Possible ZIKV cases in pregnant women, given as suspected ZIKV infection and discarded suspected cases of dengue and chikungunya
column11: Extracted from incidence per 10000 births/pregnant women – see accompanying extraction_readme.txt

column6: Number of new cases going into review – calculated manually by taking into account new confirmations, new discarded and new under review
column10: Instituto Nacional de Salud (Colombia). Boletín Epidemiológico. EW14 2016 – EW 34 2017. Available at: http://www.ins.gov.co/buscador-eventos/BoletinEpidemiologico/Forms/AllItems.aspx Accessed 15/06/2018.
column11: Extracted from cumulative values for under review, discarded and confirmed, so not strictly true incidence. New under review cases are R_t – R_(t-1) + new_D_t + new_C_t (review, discarded, confirmed)

column6: Number of new cases counted as confirmed taken from cumulative values
column10: Instituto Nacional de Salud (Colombia). Boletín Epidemiológico. EW14 2016 – EW 34 2017. Available at: http://www.ins.gov.co/buscador-eventos/BoletinEpidemiologico/Forms/AllItems.aspx Accessed 15/06/2018.
column11: Extracted from cumulative values for under review, discarded and confirmed, so not strictly true incidence. Confirmed cases are number of confirmed cases in week t less the number of cases in time t-1

column6: Notifications of microcephaly and later congenital syndrome associated with Zika virus infection. Note that different reports give the same numbers, but an earlier source refers to these cases as microcephaly whereas the later refers to them as congenital Zika syndrome. Confirmed cases are just for microcephaly cases.
